skill.name: research
skill.description: Multi-source parallel research with confidence-based synthesis.
skill.summary: Multi-source parallel research with confidence-based synthesis.
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown workflow guides. All 53 static findings are false positives. The 'backtick execution' detections are markdown code fences, not shell commands. The 'cryptographic' detections are SHA-256 content hashes in metadata. No executable code, no network requests, no filesystem operations.

content.user_title: Research any topic with multi-source verification
content.value_statement: Finding accurate information takes too long when checking multiple sources manually. This skill launches parallel research agents that search web, docs, and code simultaneously, then synthesize findings with confidence scores.
actual_capabilities: Parallel web search using multiple query angles
Local documentation lookup in ai-docs directory
Three depth modes: quick (30s), standard (2min), extensive (8min)
Confidence scoring with HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW, and CONFLICTING levels
limitations: Requires WebSearch tool availability for web research
Cannot access paywalled or authenticated content
Local docs limited to ai-docs and specs directories
Extensive mode uses more resources and time

use_cases.title: Find implementation patterns
use_cases.description: Search codebase and web for how to implement specific features with verified code examples from multiple sources.

use_cases.title: Research documentation topics
use_cases.description: Gather information from web docs and local files to write accurate technical documentation quickly.

use_cases.title: Make technology decisions
use_cases.description: Use extensive mode to compare technologies and gather best practices for architecture decisions.

prompt_templates.title: Quick fact check
prompt_templates.scenario: Verify a simple fact in 30 seconds
prompt_templates.prompt: /ai-dev-kit:research quick What is the TOON format?

prompt_templates.title: Technical research
prompt_templates.prompt: /ai-dev-kit:research standard How to implement WebSocket authentication?

prompt_templates.title: Deep comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: /ai-dev-kit:research extensive Compare Codex CLI and Claude Code workflows

prompt_templates.title: Find code examples
prompt_templates.prompt: /ai-dev-kit:research standard state management implementation examples in codebase

output: Answer: TOON is a structured documentation format for organizing library docs with hierarchies and cross-references.
Sources: Web search result from official docs, ai-docs/_index.toon

output_examples.input: /ai-dev-kit:research standard How to implement JWT validation?
output: Summary: JWT validation requires verifying signature, checking expiration, and validating claims.
Key Finding 1 (HIGH confidence): Use established libraries like jose or jsonwebtoken
Key Finding 2 (MEDIUM confidence): Always verify issuer and audience claims

best_practices: Use quick mode for simple lookups and standard mode for most research tasks
Review the Conflicting Information section when confidence shows CONFLICTING
Verify critical findings by checking the listed source URLs and file paths
anti_patterns: Using extensive mode for simple fact checks wastes time and resources
Accepting LOW confidence answers without manual verification
Ignoring the Conflicting Information section in research reports

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All three have the WebSearch and file access tools this skill needs.

faq.question: How long does each research mode take?
faq.answer: Quick mode takes about 30 seconds. Standard mode takes about 2 minutes. Extensive mode takes about 8 minutes.

faq.question: What is the confidence scoring?
faq.answer: HIGH means 3+ sources agree. MEDIUM means 2 sources agree. LOW means only 1 source. CONFLICTING means sources disagree.

faq.question: What data leaves my machine during research?
faq.answer: Only your search queries are sent to web search endpoints. No personal data or local files are transmitted.

faq.question: What happens if web search fails?
faq.answer: The skill returns available results from local docs and code sources with a note about incomplete web coverage.

faq.question: Can I customize the research agents?
faq.answer: Yes. Add custom researcher types by creating agent definitions in the agents/research/ directory of your project.
